00029 class Filtreatment {

00031 public $minval = 0;
00032 public $maxval = 0;
00033 public $error = '';
00034 
00043 function __construct() {
00044     if ( get_magic_quotes_gpc() ) {
00045         if ( !defined('MAGICQUOTES') ) define ('MAGICQUOTES', TRUE);
00046     } else {
00047         if ( !defined('MAGICQUOTES') ) define ('MAGICQUOTES', FALSE);
00048     }
00049 }

00061 public function ft_integer($input) {
00062     $input_c    = (int)$input;
00063     $mnval      = (int)$this->minval;
00064     $mxval      = (int)$this->maxval;
00065 
00066     if ( !$mnval && !$mxval ) {
00067         return $input_c;
00068     } else if ( $mnval && $mxval ) {
00069         // check if they are in order (min <  max)
00070         if ( $mnval > $mxval ) {
00071             $temp   = $mnval;
00072             $mnval  = $mxval;
00073             $mxval  = $temp;
00074         }
00075 
00076         // and then check if the value is between these values
00077         return (($input >= $mnval) && ($input <= $mxval)) ? $input_c : FALSE;
00078     } else { 
00079         // only one value set
00080         if ( $mnval ) return (($input >= $mnval) ? $input_c : FALSE );
00081         if ( $mxval ) return (($input <= $mxval) ? $input_c : FALSE );
00082     }
00083 
00084 }
00085

00087 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00096 public function ft_float($input) {
00097     $input_c    = (float)$input;
00098     $mnval      = (float)$this->minval;
00099     $mxval      = (float)$this->maxval;
00100 
00101     if ( !$mnval && !$mxval ) {
00102         return $input_c;
00103     } else if ( $mnval && $mxval ) {
00104         // check if they are in order (min <  max)
00105         if ( $this->ft_realcmp($mnval, $mxval) > 0 ) {
00106             $temp   = $mnval;
00107             $mnval  = $mxval;
00108             $mxval  = $temp;
00109         }
00110 
00111         // and then check if the value is between these values
00112         $lt = $this->ft_realcmp($input, $mxval); //-1 or 0 for true
00113         if ( $lt === -1 || $lt === 0 ) $lt = $input_c; else $lt = FALSE;
00114 
00115         $gt = $this->ft_realcmp($input, $mnval); //1 or 0 for true
00116         if ( $gt === 1 || $gt === 0 ) $gt = TRUE; else $gt = FALSE;
00117   
00118         return (( $lt && $gt ) ? $input_c : FALSE);
00119     } else { 
00120         // only one value set
00121         if ( $mnval ) {
00122             $gt = $this->ft_realcmp($input, $mnval); //1 or 0 for true
00123             return ( $gt === 1 || $gt === 0 ) ? $input_c : FALSE;
00124         }
00125 
00126         if ( $mxval ) {
00127             $lt = $this->ft_realcmp($input, $mxval); //-1 or 0 for true
00128             return ( $lt === -1 || $lt === 0 ) ? $input_c : FALSE;
00129         }
00130     }
00131 
00132 }

00143 public function ft_validdate($str) {
00144     if ( preg_match("/([0-9]{4})-([0-9]{1,2})-([0-9]{1,2})/", $str) ) {
00145         $arr = split("-",$str);     // splitting the array
00146         $yy = $arr[0];            // first element of the array is year
00147         $mm = $arr[1];            // second element is month
00148         $dd = $arr[2];            // third element is days
00149         return ( checkdate($mm, $dd, $yy) ? $str : FALSE );
00150     } else {
00151         return FALSE;
00152     }
00153 }

00164 public function ft_email($email) {
00165     if (MAGICQUOTES) {
00166         $value = stripslashes($email);
00167     }
00168 
00169     // check for @ symbol and maximum allowed lengths
00170     if (!ereg("^[^@]{1,64}@[^@]{1,255}$", $email)) { return FALSE; }
00171 
00172     // split for sections
00173     $email_array = explode("@", $email);
00174     $local_array = explode(".", $email_array[0]);
00175 
00176     for ($i = 0; $i < sizeof($local_array); $i++) {
00177         if ( !ereg("^(([A-Za-z0-9!#$%&'*+/=?^_`{|}~-][A-Za-z0-9!#$%&'*+/=?^_`{|}~\.-]{0,63})|(\"[^(\\|\")]{0,62}\"))$", $local_array[$i]) ) {
00178              return FALSE;
00179         }
00180     }
00181 
00182     if (!ereg("^\[?[0-9\.]+\]?$", $email_array[1])) { 
00183     // verify if domain is IP. If not, it must be a valid domain name 
00184         $domain_array = explode(".", $email_array[1]);
00185         if (sizeof($domain_array) < 2) { return FALSE; }
00186 
00187         for ($i = 0; $i < sizeof($domain_array); $i++) {
00188             if (!ereg("^(([A-Za-z0-9][A-Za-z0-9-]{0,61}[A-Za-z0-9])|([A-Za-z0-9]+))$", $domain_array[$i])) { 
00189                 return false; 
00190             }   
00191         }
00192     } // if 
00193 
00194     return $email;
00195 }

00208 public function ft_dbsql($value, $db_type = 'MYSQL') {
00209    if (MAGICQUOTES) {
00210         $value = stripslashes($value);
00211     }
00212 
00213     // Quote if not a number or a numeric string
00214     if (!is_numeric($value)) {
00215         switch ($db_type) {
00216             case 'MYSQL': $value = "'" . mysql_real_escape_string($value) . "'"; break;
00217             case 'PGSQL': $value = "'" . pg_escape_string($value) . "'"; break;
00218         }
00219     }
00220 
00221     return $value;
00222 }

00240 public function ft_strregex($value, $regex, $cv = 1) {
00241     $s = TRUE; //var control
00242     $regexfull = "/[^" . $regex . "]/";
00243 
00244     // function of $cv might be a clean up operation, or just verifying
00245     switch ($cv) {
00246         // verify the string
00247         case '1': 
00248             $s = ( preg_match($regexfull, $value) ? FALSE : TRUE ); 
00249         break;
00250 
00251         // cleanup the string
00252         case '2':
00253             $value = preg_replace($regexfull,'',$value);
00254         break;
00255 
00256         // if $cv is not specified or it's wrong
00257         default: if ( preg_match($regexfull, $value) ) $s = FALSE;
00258     }
00259 
00260     return ( $s ? $value : FALSE );
00261 }

00274 public function ft_xss($str, $charset = 'ISO-8859-1') {
00275     /*
00276     * Remove Null Characters
00277     *
00278     * This prevents sandwiching null characters
00279     * between ascii characters, like Java\0script.
00280     *
00281     */
00282     $str = preg_replace('/\0+/', '', $str);
00283     $str = preg_replace('/(\\\\0)+/', '', $str);
00284 
00285     /*
00286     * Validate standard character entities
00287     *
00288     * Add a semicolon if missing.  We do this to enable
00289     * the conversion of entities to ASCII later.
00290     *
00291     */
00292     $str = preg_replace('#(&\#*\w+)[\x00-\x20]+;#u',"\\1;",$str);
00293                 
00294     /*
00295     * Validate UTF16 two byte encoding (x00)
00296     *
00297     * Just as above, adds a semicolon if missing.
00298     *
00299     */
00300     $str = preg_replace('#(&\#x*)([0-9A-F]+);*#iu',"\\1\\2;",$str);
00301 
00302     /*
00303     * URL Decode
00304     *
00305     * Just in case stuff like this is submitted:
00306     *
00307     * <a href="http://%77%77%77%2E%67%6F%6F%67%6C%65%2E%63%6F%6D">Google</a>
00308     *
00309     * Note: Normally urldecode() would be easier but it removes plus signs
00310     *
00311     */  
00312     $str = preg_replace("/%u0([a-z0-9]{3})/i", "&#x\\1;", $str);
00313     $str = preg_replace("/%([a-z0-9]{2})/i", "&#x\\1;", $str);          
00314                                 
00315     /*
00316     * Convert character entities to ASCII
00317     *
00318     * This permits our tests below to work reliably.
00319     * We only convert entities that are within tags since
00320     * these are the ones that will pose security problems.
00321     *
00322     */
00323     if (preg_match_all("/<(.+?)>/si", $str, $matches)) {                
00324         for ($i = 0; $i < count($matches['0']); $i++) {
00325             $str = str_replace($matches['1'][$i],
00326                 html_entity_decode($matches['1'][$i], ENT_COMPAT, $charset), $str);
00327         }
00328     }
00329         
00330     /*
00331     * Convert all tabs to spaces
00332     *
00333     * This prevents strings like this: ja       vascript
00334     * Note: we deal with spaces between characters later.
00335     *
00336     */          
00337     $str = preg_replace("#\t+#", " ", $str);
00338         
00339     /*
00340     * Makes PHP tags safe
00341     *
00342     *  Note: XML tags are inadvertently replaced too:
00343     *
00344     *   <?xml
00345     *
00346     * But it doesn't seem to pose a problem.
00347     *
00348     */          
00349     $str = str_replace(array('<?php', '<?PHP', '<?', '?>'),  array('&lt;?php', '&lt;?PHP', '&lt;?', '?&gt;'), $str);
00350         
00351     /*
00352     * Compact any exploded words
00353     *
00354     * This corrects words like:  j a v a s c r i p t
00355     * These words are compacted back to their correct state.
00356     *
00357     */          
00358     $words = array('javascript', 'vbscript', 'script', 'applet', 'alert', 'document', 'write', 'cookie', 'window');
00359     foreach ($words as $word) {
00360         $temp = '';
00361         for ($i = 0; $i < strlen($word); $i++) {
00362             $temp .= substr($word, $i, 1)."\s*";
00363         }
00364         
00365         $temp = substr($temp, 0, -3);
00366         $str = preg_replace('#'.$temp.'#s', $word, $str);
00367         $str = preg_replace('#'.ucfirst($temp).'#s', ucfirst($word), $str);
00368     }
00369 
00370     /*
00371     * Remove disallowed Javascript in links or img tags
00372     */          
00373     $str = preg_replace("#<a.+?href=.*?(alert\(|alert&\#40;|javascript\:|window\.|document\.|\.cookie|<script|<xss).*?>.*?</a>#si", "", $str);
00374             $str = preg_replace("#<img.+?src=.*?(alert\(|alert&\#40;|javascript\:|window\.|document\.|\.cookie|<script|<xss).*?>#si","", $str);
00375     $str = preg_replace("#<(script|xss).*?>#si", "", $str);
00376 
00377     /*
00378     * Remove JavaScript Event Handlers
00379     *
00380     * Note: This code is a little blunt.  It removes
00381     * the event handler and anything up to the closing >,
00382     * but it's unlikely to be a problem.
00383     *
00384     */          
00385     $str = preg_replace('#(<[^>]+.*?)(onblur|onchange|onclick|onfocus|onload|onmouseover|onmouseup|onmousedown|onselect|onsubmit|onunload|onkeypress|onkeydown|onkeyup|onresize)[^>]*>#iU',"\\1>",$str);
00386     
00387     /*
00388     * Sanitize naughty HTML elements
00389     *
00390     * If a tag containing any of the words in the list
00391     * below is found, the tag gets converted to entities.
00392             *
00393     * So this: <blink>
00394     * Becomes: &lt;blink&gt;
00395     *
00396     */          
00397     $str = preg_replace('#<(/*\s*)(alert|applet|basefont|base|behavior|bgsound|blink|body|embed|expression|form|frameset|frame|head|html|ilayer|iframe|input|layer|link|meta|object|plaintext|style|script|textarea|title|xml|xss)([^>]*)>#is', "&lt;\\1\\2\\3&gt;", $str);
00398             
00399     /*
00400     * Sanitize naughty scripting elements
00401     *
00402     * Similar to above, only instead of looking for
00403     * tags it looks for PHP and JavaScript commands
00404     * that are disallowed.  Rather than removing the
00405     * code, it simply converts the parenthesis to entities
00406     * rendering the code un-executable.
00407     *
00408     * For example:      eval('some code')
00409     * Becomes:          eval&#40;'some code'&#41;
00410     *
00411     */
00412     $str = preg_replace('#(alert|cmd|passthru|eval|exec|system|fopen|fsockopen|file|file_get_contents|readfile|unlink)(\s*)\((.*?)\)#si', "\\1\\2&#40;\\3&#41;", $str);
00413                                             
00414     /*
00415     * Final clean up
00416     *
00417     * This adds a bit of extra precaution in case
00418     * something got through the above filters
00419     *
00420     */  
00421 
00422     $bad = array(
00423             'document.cookie'   => '',
00424             'document.write'    => '',
00425             'window.location'   => '',
00426             "javascript\s*:"    => '',
00427             "Redirect\s+302"    => '',
00428             '<!--'                      => '&lt;!--',
00429             '-->'                       => '--&gt;'
00430     );
00431     
00432     foreach ($bad as $key => $val)      {
00433             $str = preg_replace("#".$key."#i", $val, $str);
00434     }
00435 
00436     return $str;
00437 
00438 }

00440 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00447 public function display_error($mode = 1) {
00448     $errstr = ( $this->error ) ? $this->error : '';
00449     if ( $mode == 1 ) {
00450         echo '<br />' .$this->ft_xss($errstr) . '<br />';
00451     } else {
00452         return $this->ft_xss($errstr);
00453     }
00454 }

00457 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00467 private function ft_realcmp($r1, $r2) {
00468     $diff = $r1 - $r2;
00469 
00470     if ( abs($diff) < EPSILON ) return 0;
00471     else return $diff < 0 ? -1 : 1;
00472 }
